frame.name: Apply_heat
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to <fen>Food</fen>, where the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the heat and <fen>Duration</fen> of application may be specified. A <fen>Heating_instrument</fen>, generally indicated by a locative phrase, may also be expressed. Some cooking methods involve the use of a <fen>Medium</fen> (e.g. milk or water) by which heat is transferred to the <fen>Food</fen>. A less semantically prominent <fen>Food</fen> or <fen>Cook</fen> is marked <fen>Co-participant</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cook">Sally</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">an egg</fex> <fex name="Medium">in butter</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cook">Sally</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">an egg</fex> <fex name="Heating_instrument">in a teflon pan</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cook">Ellen</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">the eggs</fex> <fex name="Co-participant">with chopped tomatoes and garlic</fex>.</ex>
This frame differs from Cooking_creation in focusing on the process of handling the ingredients, rather than the edible entity that results from the process.</def-root>

FE.name: Cook
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.<ex><fex name="Cook">Drew</fex> <t>sauteed</t> the garlic in butter.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Heating_instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the entity that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Jim <t>browned</t> the roast <fex name="Heat_instr">in the oven</fex>.</ex>
This FE will take precedence over <fen>Container</fen> when both are expressed in the same constituent. For example:
<ex>Kate <t>cooked</t> the rice <fex name="Heat_instr">in a rice-cooker</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs. <ex>We <t>baked</t> the cake <fex name="Place">in the kitchen</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Food
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Food</fen> is the entity to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.<ex>Suzy usually <t>steams</t> <fex name="Food">the broccoli</fex>.</ex>In instructional imperatives, this FE, which would be used for the (missing) object, is tagged CNI:<ex><t>Cook</t> on low heat for two hours.<fex name="Food">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the heat application occurs. <ex>Jim <t>roasted</t> the chestnuts <fex name="Time">in the evening</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which heat is applied to <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Kate <t>blanched</t>the broccoli <fex name="Means">by throwing it into a pot of boiling water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.<ex>John <t>baked</t> cookies <fex name="Purp">to show Patti that he was sorry</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Duration</fen> is the amount of <fen>Time</fen> heat is applied to the <fen>Food</fen>.<ex>Jim <t>boiled</t> the egg <fex name="Duration">for three minutes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the substance through which heat is applied to the <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Bobby <t>fried</t> the potatoes <fex name="Medium">in oil</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Co-participant</fen> is the gramatically less prominent of two foods to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.<ex> Kate <t>baked</t> the apples <fex name="Co-participant">with cinnamon</fex>.</ex><ex>Joe <t>roasted</t> potatoes <fex name="Co-participant">with the chicken</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Temperature_setting
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the <fen>Heating_instrument</fen> for the <fen>Food</fen>.
<ex>He <t>baked</t> the cookies <fex name="Temp">at 350 degrees</fex> for 11 minutes.</ex> <ex>She <t>microwaved</t> the popcorn <fex name="Temp">on high</fex>.</ex> <ex>You can't <t>cook</t> popcorn <fex name="Temp">on low heat</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which heat application occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the cooking event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Cook</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex><t>Saute</t> the onions <fex name="Manner">gently</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Container</fen> holds the <fen>Food</fen> to which heat is applied.<ex><t>Boil</t> the potatoes <fex name="Container">in a medium-sized pan</fex>.</ex>Things that apply the heat directly are <fen>Heating_Instrument</fen>s, e.g. crock-pot, electric skillet.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>THe person for whose benefit the food is cooked.</def-root>
